space_museums.name: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: World’s largest collection of aviation and space artifacts, including Apollo 11 Command Module and Wright Flyer
space_museums.additional_info: Flagship building on the National Mall; free admission; major renovation 2018-2026

space_museums.name: Steven F. Udvar-Hazy Center (NASM Annex)
space_museums.famous_for: Space Shuttle Discovery, SR-71 Blackbird, vertical viewing hangars
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Smithsonian; 760,000-ft² facility at Dulles airport

space_museums.name: Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex
space_museums.famous_for: Historic launch pads, Space Shuttle Atlantis, Saturn V Center
space_museums.additional_info: Official NASA visitor center; bus tours of active facilities

space_museums.name: Space Center Houston (NASA Johnson Visitor Center)
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo Mission Control, Space Shuttle Independence-747 stack
space_museums.additional_info: 400+ space artifacts; STEM camps and tram tours

space_museums.name: U.S. Space & Rocket Center
space_museums.famous_for: Saturn V, Space Camp programs, world’s largest space museum by floor area
space_museums.additional_info: Official NASA Marshall Visitor Center

space_museums.name: National Museum of the U.S. Air Force (Space Gallery)
space_museums.famous_for: X-planes, Apollo 15 Command Module, extensive missile & space gallery
space_museums.additional_info: Oldest military aviation museum; free admission

space_museums.name: Cosmosphere
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo 13 Command Module, Soviet Vostok and V-2 hardware
space_museums.additional_info: Second-largest U.S.–Soviet artifact collection after Smithsonian

space_museums.name: Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Space Shuttle Enterprise displayed on WWII aircraft carrier
space_museums.additional_info: Hudson River pier location; also houses Concorde

space_museums.name: San Diego Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo 9 Command Module, Montgolfier balloon replica
space_museums.additional_info: Located in Balboa Park; aviation & space emphasis

space_museums.name: Pima Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: 425+ aircraft over 80 acres, Titan II missile gallery
space_museums.additional_info: Adjacent “Boneyard” bus tours of AMARG storage site

space_museums.name: Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Hughes H-4 Spruce Goose, SR-71 Blackbird
space_museums.additional_info: Includes Titan II SLV and water-park built around 747-100

space_museums.name: The Museum of Flight
space_museums.famous_for: Space Shuttle Trainer, Apollo F-1 engine segments
space_museums.additional_info: 130+ aircraft plus space exhibits in Charles Simonyi Space Gallery

space_museums.name: California Science Center (Samuel Oschin Air & Space Center)
space_museums.famous_for: Space Shuttle Endeavour (vertical stack under construction)
space_museums.additional_info: Free general admission; hands-on STEM exhibits

space_museums.name: NASA Ames Exploration Center
space_museums.famous_for: SOFIA telescope nose-section, Moon rock touch piece
space_museums.additional_info: Focuses on current NASA research; free admission

space_museums.name: Virginia Air & Space Science Center (NASA Langley Visitor Center)
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo 12 Command Module, Mercury test capsule
space_museums.additional_info: IMAX theater and STEM programs

space_museums.name: Goddard Space Flight Center Visitor Center
space_museums.famous_for: Hubble and James Webb mission exhibits, outdoor rocket garden
space_museums.additional_info: Free admission; monthly model-rocket launches

space_museums.name: Adler Planetarium & Astronomy Museum
space_museums.famous_for: First planetarium in the Western Hemisphere, Gemini 12 capsule
space_museums.additional_info: Lake Michigan campus; sky shows in multiple domes

space_museums.name: New Mexico Museum of Space History
space_museums.famous_for: International Space Hall of Fame, rocket park overlooking desert
space_museums.additional_info: Hosts annual high-altitude balloon and sounding-rocket launches

space_museums.name: Great Lakes Science Center (NASA Glenn Visitor Center)
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo Command Module, Skylab Orbital Workshop trainer
space_museums.additional_info: STEM labs and lakefront wind turbine exhibit

space_museums.name: Stafford Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Gemini 6A and Apollo–Soyuz hardware honoring astronaut Tom Stafford
space_museums.additional_info: 121,800-ft² facility on Historic Route 66

space_museums.name: Armstrong Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Neil Armstrong memorabilia, Gemini 8 capsule
space_museums.additional_info: Moon-shaped concrete structure near Armstrong’s birthplace

space_museums.name: Cradle of Aviation Museum
space_museums.famous_for: LM-13 Lunar Module, Grumman space hardware displays
space_museums.additional_info: Long Island’s aerospace legacy museum at former Mitchel Field

space_museums.name: Wings Over the Rockies Air & Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Full-scale X-Wing starfighter, space-themed flight sims
space_museums.additional_info: Housed in former Air Force Base hangar

space_museums.name: Canada Aviation and Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Canadarm prototype, International Space Station exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: 135 aircraft; part of Ingenium national museums

space_museums.name: Cosmodome
space_museums.famous_for: Space camp simulations, Apollo and Mars VR missions
space_museums.additional_info: Only major space-focused museum in Canada

space_museums.name: H.R. MacMillan Space Centre
space_museums.famous_for: Planetarium Star Theatre, live rocket launches for students
space_museums.additional_info: Located in Vanier Park near Maritime Museum

space_museums.name: Musée de l’Air et de l’Espace (Paris Air & Space Museum)
space_museums.famous_for: Concorde prototypes, Ariane 1, historic rockets
space_museums.additional_info: Oldest aviation museum; built on Paris-Le Bourget Airport

space_museums.name: Cité de l’espace
space_museums.famous_for: Full-scale Ariane 5, Mir station replica, Mars rover yard
space_museums.additional_info: 20-acre space park in Europe’s aerospace capital

space_museums.name: Euro Space Center
space_museums.famous_for: Space shuttle mock-up, astronaut training simulators
space_museums.additional_info: Hosts residential space camps and ESA outreach

space_museums.name: Technik Museum Speyer (Space Flight Exhibition)
space_museums.famous_for: Buran orbiter OK-GLI, Soyuz TM-19 capsule
space_museums.additional_info: Europe’s largest manned-spaceflight exhibit

space_museums.name: Deutsches Museum (Transport-Aerospace Galleries)
space_museums.famous_for: V-2 rocket, space instrumentation, interactive ISS modules
space_museums.additional_info: World’s largest science museum complex

space_museums.name: National Space Centre
space_museums.famous_for: 42-meter Rocket Tower housing Blue Streak and Thor Able
space_museums.additional_info: Sir Patrick Moore Planetarium and Challenger Learning Centre

space_museums.name: Science Museum (Exploring Space Gallery)
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo 10 Command Module, full-scale Eagle LM replica
space_museums.additional_info: Free museum in South Kensington; new space gallery opening 2025

space_museums.name: Royal Observatory Greenwich (Astronomy Centre & Peter Harrison Planetarium)
space_museums.famous_for: Prime Meridian, early Astronomer Royal instruments, space science exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Royal Museums Greenwich complex

space_museums.name: CosmoCaixa Barcelona
space_museums.famous_for: Planetarium and ‘Touch the Moon’ meteorite displays
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by La Caixa Foundation; hands-on science halls

space_museums.name: Copernicus Science Centre
space_museums.famous_for: Heaven of Copernicus planetarium, Mars yard rover demos
space_museums.additional_info: Over 450 interactive exhibits on Vistula riverfront

space_museums.name: Memorial Museum of Cosmonautics
space_museums.famous_for: Vostok and Soyuz capsules, Lunokhod rover, massive Conquerors of Space monument
space_museums.additional_info: Renovated 2009 with international ISS gallery

space_museums.name: RKK Energia Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Sputnik prototypes, Sergei Korolev artifacts, Mir core module mock-up
space_museums.additional_info: Located inside rocket-design bureau; limited public access

space_museums.name: Museum of Space Exploration (Pereiaslav)
space_museums.famous_for: RD-219 engine, SK-II spacesuit, Korolev memorial room
space_museums.additional_info: Housed in relocated 1891 wooden church

space_museums.name: Space Expo (ESA-ESTEC Visitor Centre)
space_museums.famous_for: ISS Columbus mock-up, real Soyuz capsule, Ariane rocket models
space_museums.additional_info: Gateway to ESA’s main technology centre ESTEC

space_museums.name: Hong Kong Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Iconic egg-shaped dome planetarium, OMNIMAX Space Theatre
space_museums.additional_info: Two interactive halls: Hall of the Cosmos & Hall of Space Exploration

space_museums.name: Shanghai Astronomy Museum (Shanghai Planetarium)
space_museums.famous_for: World’s largest planetarium by building area, immersive digital sky dome
space_museums.additional_info: Architecturally spiral design embodying orbits

space_museums.name: China Science and Technology Museum (Space Science Hall)
space_museums.famous_for: Long March rockets, Shenzhou spacecraft models
space_museums.additional_info: Largest comprehensive science museum in China; rebuilt 2009

space_museums.name: JAXA Tsukuba Space Center ‘Space Dome’
space_museums.famous_for: ISS Kibo module mock-up, H-II launch vehicle engines
space_museums.additional_info: Guided tours of assembly & control facilities

space_museums.name: Miraikan – National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation
space_museums.famous_for: Geo-Cosmos LED globe, space-elevator concept exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Japan’s Science and Technology Agency

space_museums.name: Indian Space Science Museum (VSSC Space Museum)
space_museums.famous_for: Scale models of SLV-III & PSLV, history of ISRO missions
space_museums.additional_info: Situated inside Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre campus

space_museums.name: B.M. Birla Space Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Planetarium and reproductions of space probes
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Birla Science Centre complex

space_museums.name: Sharjah Centre for Astronomy and Space Sciences
space_museums.famous_for: UAE’s first deep-space planetarium, Mars Hope Probe gallery
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by University of Sharjah

space_museums.name: Iziko Planetarium & Digital Dome
space_museums.famous_for: Cutting-edge 8K digital sky shows, African sky myths
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Iziko Museums network

space_museums.name: Planetarium Science Center (Bibliotheca Alexandrina)
space_museums.famous_for: 48-ft tilted dome, ‘History of Astronomy’ hall
space_museums.additional_info: Located within modern Library of Alexandria complex

space_museums.name: Planetario Galileo Galilei
space_museums.famous_for: Iconic UFO-shaped dome, meteorite samples
space_museums.additional_info: Recently upgraded 8K projection system

space_museums.name: Planetario Alfa
space_museums.famous_for: IMAX-DOME theatre, space exploration exhibitions
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Parque Planetario fund; extensive STEM outreach

space_museums.name: Museum of Astronomy and Related Sciences (MAST)
space_museums.famous_for: Historic 19th-century observatory, space geodesy exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Brazil’s Ministry of Science

space_museums.name: Planetário Professor Aristóteles Orsini (Ibirapuera Planetarium)
space_museums.famous_for: First planetarium in South America, Zeiss projector
space_museums.additional_info: Located in Ibirapuera Park; reopened after 2016 refurbishment

space_museums.name: Powerhouse Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Apollo 11 telemetry dish, Zero-G space-lab mock-up
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Museum of Applied Arts & Sciences (MAAS)

space_museums.name: Questacon – National Science and Technology Centre
space_museums.famous_for: NASA Deep Space Network exhibits, rotating gravity well
space_museums.additional_info: 350+ interactive galleries; joint Australia-Japan project

space_museums.name: Stardome Observatory & Planetarium
space_museums.famous_for: Zeiss star projector, Space Gallery on Māori astronomy
space_museums.additional_info: Located on volcanic One Tree Hill (Maungakiekie)

space_museums.name: National Gwacheon Science Museum (Astronomy Hall)
space_museums.famous_for: 360-degree dome cinema, Korean satellite history
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Ministry of Science and ICT

space_museums.name: Planetarium Negara (National Planetarium Malaysia)
space_museums.famous_for: Blue domed planetarium, Angkasawan program gallery
space_museums.additional_info: Rocket replica in Lake Gardens; space-themed rides

space_museums.name: Spaceport (Wirral)
space_museums.famous_for: Interactive Space-Age zone, Mars rover simulator
space_museums.additional_info: Located in ferry terminal on River Mersey

space_museums.name: Science City Kolkata (Space Odyssey Hall)
space_museums.famous_for: Largest science centre in India, Cosmic Voyage space theatre
space_museums.additional_info: Run by National Council of Science Museums

space_museums.name: Europlanetarium Genk
space_museums.famous_for: Planetarium shows and Cosmodrome space flight simulator
space_museums.additional_info: Green energy–powered dome in Limburg tourism park

space_museums.name: Andøya Space Exploration Centre (Spaceship Aurora)
space_museums.famous_for: Northern Lights mission simulator, sounding-rocket heritage
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Andøya Spaceport complex above Arctic Circle

space_museums.name: Inspiration Mars Exhibition (Archenhold Observatory)
space_museums.famous_for: World’s longest refracting telescope, spaceflight galleries
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Stiftung Planetarium Berlin

space_museums.name: Johannes Kepler Observatory & Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Kepler’s last residence, early celestial mechanics exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Small heritage site in Old Town

space_museums.name: Sir Patrick Moore Planetarium (Thinktank Science Museum)
space_museums.famous_for: Digistar 7 digital dome, UK’s largest planetarium seating 300
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Birmingham’s Millennium Point complex

space_museums.name: Griffith Observatory (Space Exhibits)
space_museums.famous_for: Foucault pendulum, Tesla coil, immersive space dioramas
space_museums.additional_info: Iconic Art Deco landmark overlooking Hollywood; free admission

space_museums.name: Exploradôme Space Pavilion
space_museums.famous_for: Hands-on cosmology exhibits for children
space_museums.additional_info: Partner of Exploratorium (San Francisco) model

space_museums.name: Korea Astronomy and Space Science Museum (BOAO)
space_museums.famous_for: 62-inch reflector, public star parties, space-probe models
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Korea Astronomy and Space Science Institute

space_museums.name: State Museum of the History of Cosmonautics (Tsiolkovsky Museum)
space_museums.famous_for: Original Tsiolkovsky sketches, Vostok 1 descent module
space_museums.additional_info: Expanded “Vostok” building opened 2021

space_museums.name: Air Force Space and Missile Museum
space_museums.city_or_region: Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, Florida
space_museums.famous_for: Launch Complex 26 blockhouse, Jupiter-C and Redstone rockets
space_museums.additional_info: Tours via Cape Canaveral Space Force Museum Foundation

space_museums.name: American Space Museum & U.S. Space Walk of Fame
space_museums.famous_for: Astronaut-signed Firing Room consoles, Space Shuttle memorabilia
space_museums.additional_info: Honors launch teams on outdoor Riverfront monuments

space_museums.name: Astro-Tec Space Exploration Center
space_museums.famous_for: Replica of Diwata-1 microsatellite, Filipino space technology
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Philippine Space Agency; first of its kind in country

space_museums.name: Huntsville Planetarium and Space Academy (South Africa)
space_museums.famous_for: Modular Mars habitat mock-ups, African space science outreach
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Sci-Bono Discovery Centre partnership

space_museums.name: Space Place at Carter Observatory
space_museums.famous_for: Historic Thomas Cooke 9-inch refractor, Māori star lore exhibitions
space_museums.additional_info: Planetarium show-case in Botanic Garden

space_museums.name: Yuri Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center Museum
space_museums.famous_for: Full-scale Mir mock-up, Soyuz centrifuge trainer
space_museums.additional_info: Access typically via pre-arranged group tours

space_museums.name: Hayden Planetarium (Rose Center for Earth and Space)
space_museums.famous_for: Digital Universe Atlas, iconic glass cube housing spherical theater
space_museums.additional_info: Part of American Museum of Natural History

space_museums.name: Virginia Aviation Museum (Space Gallery)
space_museums.famous_for: Meteorite and Moon rock displays, atmospheric balloons
space_museums.additional_info: Currently closed; artifacts transferred to Science Museum of Virginia

space_museums.name: Bursa Gökmen Space and Aviation Training Center (GUHEM)
space_museums.famous_for: 13,500-m² interactive space galleries, ESA-accredited training modules
space_museums.additional_info: Funded by Bursa Aerospace Cluster and TÜBİTAK

space_museums.name: S.P. Korolev Museum of Cosmonautics and Rocket Technology (Peter and Paul Fortress)
space_museums.famous_for: First Russian space museum (1932), rocket engines designed by Glushko
space_museums.additional_info: Part of Museum of Artillery, Engineers and Signal Corps

space_museums.name: Flandrau Science Center & Planetarium
space_museums.famous_for: University-run planetarium with OSIRIS-REx mission exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Associated with University of Arizona Lunar & Planetary Lab

space_museums.name: Space Discovery Centre, Spaceport Cornwall
space_museums.famous_for: Virgin Orbit launch operations gallery, UK space-flight future showcase
space_museums.additional_info: Located at Cornwall Airport Newquay horizontal-launch site

space_museums.name: US Astronaut Hall of Fame (Planet Play) at KSC
space_museums.famous_for: Interactive astronaut history exhibits, Mercury-to-Shuttle memorabilia
space_museums.additional_info: Now integrated into Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex

space_museums.name: Museo Nacional de Aeronáutica y del Espacio de Chile (MNAE)
space_museums.famous_for: Chilean satellite program models, meteorite collection
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by Chilean Air Force

space_museums.name: Aviation & Space Gallery, Pima County Youth Museum (Children’s Museum)
space_museums.famous_for: Hands-on space science for children under 10
space_museums.additional_info: STEM outreach partner with Pima Air & Space Museum

space_museums.name: Observatoire de Paris ‘Universe and Galaxies’ Gallery
space_museums.famous_for: Historic 17th-century observatory, modern cosmology exhibits
space_museums.additional_info: Rare public open-days for science festival events

space_museums.name: National Planetarium Abuja
space_museums.famous_for: NigeriaSat-1 and NigComSat mission displays, 25-m dome theater
space_museums.additional_info: Operated by National Space Research and Development Agency
